name: Tomatoes
favorableSoilType: Loamy, well-drained soil with a pH of 6.0-6.8
dos: Plant in a sunny spot
Use stakes or cages to support growth
donts: Don't overwater
Avoid planting in the same spot each year to prevent disease
timeTaken: 60-100 days to harvest depending on variety
idealMoisture: Keep soil consistently moist but not soggy
additionalTips: Mulch around plants to retain moisture and prevent weeds.

name: Lettuce
favorableSoilType: Loamy, fertile soil with good drainage and a pH of 6.0-7.0
dos: Grow in partial shade in warmer climates
Harvest leaves individually for longer production
donts: Don't allow soil to dry out completely
Avoid high temperatures as they cause bolting
idealMoisture: Keep soil moist, especially during germination

name: Carrots
favorableSoilType: Loose, sandy, well-drained soil with a pH of 6.0-7.0
dos: Thin seedlings to allow room for root development
Keep soil free of stones to prevent misshapen carrots
donts: Don't over-fertilize with nitrogen, it promotes leafy growth over root development
Avoid compacted soils
idealMoisture: Keep soil consistently moist but avoid waterlogging
additionalTips: Mulching helps maintain moisture and temperature control.

name: Zucchini
favorableSoilType: Loamy, well-drained soil with a pH of 6.0-7.0
dos: Plant in full sun
Harvest regularly to encourage further production
donts: Don't overwater, especially on the leaves
Avoid planting too close together
idealMoisture: Keep soil moist but not soggy
additionalTips: Use mulch to retain soil moisture and control weeds.

name: Cucumbers
favorableSoilType: Loamy, well-drained soil with a pH of 6.0-7.0
dos: Provide trellises for better airflow and easier harvesting
Pick cucumbers regularly to encourage production
donts: Don't let the soil dry out completely
Avoid planting too close together to prevent fungal disease
idealMoisture: Keep soil moist, especially during fruiting
additionalTips: Cucumbers need consistent watering to prevent bitterness.

name: Spinach
favorableSoilType: Well-drained, rich soil with a pH of 6.0-7.0
dos: Grow in partial shade in warmer climates
Harvest young leaves for the best flavor
donts: Don't let soil dry out completely
Avoid planting in the heat to prevent bolting
idealMoisture: Keep soil consistently moist but not waterlogged
additionalTips: Mulch around plants to retain soil moisture.

name: Bell Peppers
favorableSoilType: Loamy, well-drained soil with a pH of 6.0-6.8
dos: Plant in full sun
Use stakes or cages to support plants
donts: Don't overwater, it can cause root rot
Avoid planting in low-light conditions
idealMoisture: Keep soil consistently moist but avoid waterlogging
additionalTips: Mulching helps retain soil moisture and reduce weeds.

name: Peas
favorableSoilType: Loamy, well-drained soil with a pH of 6.0-7.5
dos: Plant early in the season for best results
Provide trellises for support
donts: Don't allow soil to dry out
Avoid overwatering, especially after the plants flower
idealMoisture: Keep soil evenly moist, particularly during flowering and pod formation
additionalTips: Harvest pods regularly to encourage continued production.

name: Green Beans
favorableSoilType: Loamy, well-drained soil with a pH of 6.0-7.0
dos: Provide trellises for pole beans
Harvest beans regularly for the best yield
donts: Don't over-fertilize with nitrogen
Avoid planting in cold, wet soil
idealMoisture: Keep soil moist but not soggy
additionalTips: Mulching helps retain soil moisture and reduce weed growth.

name: Radishes
favorableSoilType: Loose, well-drained soil with a pH of 6.0-7.0
dos: Plant in cool weather for best results
Thin seedlings to allow room for root development
donts: Don't overwater
Avoid planting in hot weather to prevent bitterness
additionalTips: Succession planting allows for continuous harvest throughout the season.
